intro: Bupleurum minus, commonly known as Chinese thornapple, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its ornamental value is also appreciated in gardens. However, it can become invasive in certain regions if not managed properly.
